channel.title: ::kill command
channel.description:
yeah, so i need help with the ::kill command. Please make it so they don't lose items, and it teleports them to home. (just leave the coords to whatever, i'll edit myself) i made one myself but it failed epicly o:
thanks --mahdavi

item.title: ::kill command
item.dc:creator: @mahdaviscape mahdaviscape
item.description:
@mahdaviscape wrote:

.\client.java:10776: cannot find symbol symbol : variable teleportToX location: class client p.teleportToX = 1234; ^ .\client.java:10777: cannot find symbol symbol : variable teleportToY location: class client p.teleportToY = 1234; ^ .\client.java:10782: cannot find symbol symbol : class Execption location: class client } catch (Execption e) { ^ 3 errors Press any key to continue . . .
i fixed the 100 code error but now i get this.

Read full topic

item.title: ::kill command
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Despair Mr. Despair
item.description:
@Mr_Despair wrote:

Roflol 100 error compilng.. help pl0x ^^

100 errors are usually caused by too many or too few brackets. Each opening bracket { must have a closing bracket }.

Read full topic

item.title: ::kill command
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“John459, post:5, topic:338264”]You can’t rep++, but it doesn’t matter anyways. Here:

if (command.startsWith("kill")) { try { String otherPName = command.substring(5); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if (otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; p.teleportToX = 1234; p.teleportToY = 5678; p.sM("You have been killed by " + playerName + "!"); } else { sM("That name does not exist."); } } catch (Execption e) { sM("Error in the kill command!"); } }

Edit: sorry soul, didn’t see your post.[/quote]

That’s fine; I actually forgot to add the try/catch block and your post reminded me to.

Read full topic

item.title: ::kill command
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

You can’t rep++, but it doesn’t matter anyways. Here:

if (command.startsWith("kill")) { try { String otherPName = command.substring(5); int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName); if (otherPIndex != -1) { client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; p.teleportToX = 1234; p.teleportToY = 5678; p.sM("You have been killed by " + playerName + "!"); } else { sM("That name does not exist."); } } catch (Execption e) { sM("Error in the kill command!"); } }

Edit: sorry soul, didn’t see your post.

Read full topic

item.title: ::kill command
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

if(command.startsWith("kill")) { try { String person = command.substring(5); int id = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(person); client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[person]; p.teleportToX = int; p.teleportToY = int; } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("invalid"); } }

Read full topic

item.title: ::kill command
item.dc:creator: @mahdaviscape mahdaviscape
item.description:
@mahdaviscape wrote:

thanks, i’ll tey it now.

EDIT: I should have seen it beore, but have a delta based server and this wouldn’t work even when i tried to convert it o.o

WILL REP++ to sucessfull helper thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: ::kill command
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“kill”) && playerRights == 3) {
String nam = command.substring(4);
client victim = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(nam)];

        victim.teleportToX = 2192
        victim.teleportToY = 3150
        victim.sendMessage("You have been auto-killed by " + playerName + "!");
    }[/code]

I don’t know if that will work, if it doesn’t then maybe you can fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: ::kill command
item.dc:creator: @mahdaviscape mahdaviscape
item.description:
@mahdaviscape wrote:

yeah, so i need help with the ::kill command.
Please make it so they don’t lose items, and it teleports them to home. (just leave the coords to whatever, i’ll edit myself)
i made one myself but it failed epicly o:

thanks --mahdavi
